title: Communication Tools
description: A diverse set of tools to manage, analyze, and improve your digital communications

pingTest.name: Advanced Ping Test
pingTest.description: Measure response time and connection stability to servers and devices
pingTest.howToUse: Enter an IP address or domain name and click 'Start Test'
pingTest.inputPlaceholder: Enter IP address or domain name
pingTest.tips: Lower response times indicate better connections. A response time under 50ms is considered excellent for applications requiring immediate response like online gaming.

jitterAnalysis.name: Jitter Analysis
jitterAnalysis.description: Measure the stability of response times and its impact on connection quality
jitterAnalysis.howToUse: Select the server you want to test and click 'Start Analysis'
jitterAnalysis.tips: Low jitter (less than 10ms) is essential for video calls and media streaming without interruptions.

packetLossTest.name: Packet Loss Test
packetLossTest.description: Analyze the percentage of lost packets during data transmission over the network
packetLossTest.howToUse: Enter an IP address or domain name, choose the number of packets and click 'Start Test'
packetLossTest.inputPlaceholder: Enter IP address or domain name
packetLossTest.tips: Packet loss under 1% is ideal for most applications. Loss rates above 2.5% may cause issues with voice and video communication.

portScanner.name: Port Scanner
portScanner.description: Check the status of network ports on a specific device or server
portScanner.howToUse: Enter an IP address or domain name, then select a port range or specific ports to scan
portScanner.inputPlaceholder: Enter IP address or domain name
portScanner.tips: Open ports may be necessary for certain applications, but they can also represent security vulnerabilities if not required.

dnsLookup.name: DNS Lookup
dnsLookup.description: Look up DNS records for a specific domain name
dnsLookup.howToUse: Enter a domain name, select record type, and click 'Search'
dnsLookup.tips: DNS records are responsible for translating domain names to IP addresses and routing email and other services.

traceroute.name: Traceroute
traceroute.description: Trace the path of packets from your device to a destination server
traceroute.howToUse: Enter an IP address or domain name and click 'Start Trace'
traceroute.inputPlaceholder: Enter IP address or domain name
traceroute.tips: Traceroute helps identify bottlenecks or issues in the connection path, especially when experiencing slowness or disconnections.

networkConfigAnalyzer.name: Network Configuration Analyzer
networkConfigAnalyzer.description: Analyze and display current network settings in an easy-to-understand way
networkConfigAnalyzer.howToUse: Click 'Analyze Network' to view your current network information
networkConfigAnalyzer.tips: Understanding your network configuration is the first step in diagnosing connection issues and improving network performance.
